Food Banks NJ.name: Community FoodBank of New Jersey
Food Banks NJ.description: The Community FoodBank of New Jersey provides food assistance programs and services to help families in need. They offer job training programs, nutrition education, and opportunities for volunteering and advocacy. The organization is committed to addressing the root causes of hunger and empowering communities across New Jersey.
Food Banks NJ.location: Hillside and Egg Harbor Township, NJ
Food Banks NJ.target_group: Families in need, individuals facing food insecurity

Food Banks NJ.name: Food Bank of South Jersey
Food Banks NJ.description: The Food Bank of South Jersey exists to provide an immediate solution to the urgent problem of hunger by providing food to people in need, teaching them to eat nutritiously, and helping them to find sustainable ways to improve their lives. In 2024, the need for food assistance continued to grow, reaching historic highs. With more families facing rising costs, we provided a record amount of food and services to ensure our neighbors had the support they needed.
Food Banks NJ.target_group: Individuals and families in need of food assistance

Food Banks NJ.name: Feeding America
Food Banks NJ.description: Feeding America is a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization recognized by the IRS. It focuses on charitable food assistance and addressing issues related to hunger and food insecurity. The organization provides various programs and resources to support communities in need. They also engage in research and policy advocacy related to hunger and nutrition.
Food Banks NJ.location: 161 N. Clark Street, Suite 700, Chicago, IL
Food Banks NJ.target_group: Children, Seniors, African Americans, Latinos, Native Americans, Rural Communities

Food Banks NJ.name: Food Bank of Somerset County Inc.
Food Banks NJ.description: The mission of The Food Bank Network is to distribute food and provide other basic human needs to those less fortunate in our community. They aim to help feed and provision people in need until they become self-sufficient. The organization operates through a warehouse-pantry in Bridgewater and satellite food pantries. They assist Somerset County residents requesting help, either directly or through referrals.
Food Banks NJ.location: 7E Easy Street, Middlebrook Crossroads Industrial Park, Bound Brook, NJ
Food Banks NJ.target_group: Individuals living below the poverty line in Somerset County

Food Banks NJ.name: Interfaith Food Pantry Network
Food Banks NJ.description: The Interfaith Food Pantry Network has improved the health and well-being of Morris County residents in need by providing access to food, education, and other resources for over 25 years. They are committed to ending hunger and supporting self-sufficiency. The organization also offers volunteer opportunities and ways to support through donations.
Food Banks NJ.target_group: Residents of Morris County facing food insecurity

Homeless Resources NJ.name: New Jersey Department of Community Affairs |
Housing - Get Help: New Jersey Social Services - Research Guides at New Jersey State Library
Emergency Housing & Homelessness Assistance | Princeton, NJ
HomeFront
Homeless Resources NJ.description: HomeFront’s mission is to end homelessness in Central New Jersey by harnessing the caring, resources, and expertise of the community. They provide shelter, food, and transformative assistance to help families become self-sufficient. The organization addresses immediate needs such as food assistance, clothing, and childcare while promoting physical and mental well-being. They aim to empower individuals with educational and employment opportunities.

Immigrant Resources NJ.name: New Jersey Alliance for Immigrant Justice
New Jersey Organizations  - National Immigration Legal Services Directory - Nonprofit Resource Center
Central Jersey Legal Services
Immigrant Resources NJ.description: Central Jersey Legal Services is a nonprofit law firm that offers free legal help in civil (non-criminal) cases for low-income residents of Mercer, Middlesex, and Union Counties. They provide information, advice, and representation to individuals who have a legal problem but cannot afford an attorney.

Mental Health Resources NJ.name: Department of Human Services | Mental Health Resources
Mental Health Association of NJ
Mental Health Resources NJ.description: The Mental Health Association of NJ provides emotional support, information, and referrals. They offer programs and services to support individuals and families, educate and train, collaborate, advocate, and support equity. They also have a newsletter for updates on news, facts, and articles related to mental health.

Mental Health Resources NJ.name: Health Resources and Services Administration | HRSA
National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) | Mental Health Support, Education & Advocacy
Directory of Morris County Mental Health Services – Morris County, NJ

Veteran Resources NJ.name: Burlington County Department of Military and Veteran’s Services
Veteran Resources NJ.description: The Burlington County Department of Military and Veteran’s Services is dedicated to serving the military and veteran community. They work closely with veteran organizations and military bases to provide current information from the U.S. Department of Veteran’s Affairs and the New Jersey Department of Military and Veteran’s Affairs. The office offers various services and has a dedicated staff to meet the needs of Burlington County veterans.
Veteran Resources NJ.target_group: active duty military personnel and veterans

Veteran Resources NJ.name: New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs

Disability Resources NJ.name: New Jersey Disability Resources and Advocacy Organizations - Olmstead Rights
Hunterdon County Office on Disability Services
Disability Resources NJ.description: The Hunterdon County Office on Disability Services is a specialized section of the Division of Senior, Disabilities and Veterans Services. It provides information and referrals to community members with disabilities and offers a wide range of resources to assist them in remaining autonomous and empowered. The office also helps individuals with disabilities apply for Social Security Disability benefits and NJ Temporary Disability.
Disability Resources NJ.location: 71 Main Street, PO Box 2900, Flemington, New Jersey
Disability Resources NJ.target_group: Individuals with disabilities, their caregivers, and the general public

Disability Resources NJ.name: Division of Disability Services | Resources and Publications
